page.title: 06CLAYTON WEST 50 YEARS AGO
page.content: Churches 50 Years ago in Clayton West there were seven churches . Parkside Methodist, Mount Tabor and United Reformed were on Chapel Hill.All Hallows was on Church Lane opposite the Post Office. The Baptist and Wesleyan Reformed churches were on High Street and Wakefield Road Methodist Church was on the A636. Parkside Methodist has being converted into bungalows Mount Tabor has now being pulled down. The Baptist Church is now up for sale. Public Houses The Commercial andthe Shoulder of Mutton stood in Clayton West along with the Clayton West Working Mens Club on Scott Hill.
